reasoning: Reporting incidence of new heart failure cases. Global incidence ~220 per 100k person-years based on Framingham Heart Study and European cohort data from early 2000s. Incidence increases dramatically with age, from <1 per 1000 in young adults to >10 per 1000 in those >65 years.
source: Lloyd-Jones DM et al. (2002). Lifetime risk for developing congestive heart failure: the Framingham Heart Study. Circulation. 106(24):3068-72
